title: A lower bound on the value of entangled binary games
abstract: A two-player one-round binary game consists of two cooperative players who each replies by one bit to a message that he receives privately; they win the game if both questions and answers satisfy some predetermined property. A game is called entangled if the players are allowed to share a priori entanglement. It is well-known that the maximum winning probability (value) of entangled XOR-games (binary games in which the predetermined property depends only on the XOR of the two output bits) can be computed by a semidefinite program. In this paper we extend this result in the following sense; if a binary game is uniform, meaning that in an optimal strategy the marginal distributions of the output of each player are uniform, then its entangled value can be efficiently computed by a semidefinite program. We also introduce a lower bound on the entangled value of a general two-player one-round game; this bound depends on the size of the output set of each player and can be computed by a semidefinite program. In particular, we show that if the game is binary, $\omega_q$ is its entangled value, and $\omega_{sdp}$ is the optimum value of the corresponding semidefinite program, then $0.68\,\omega_{sdp} < \omega_q \leq \omega_{sdp}$.

motivations: There is a need to understand and quantify the value of entangled binary games, where cooperative players share prior entanglement to achieve a common goal.
Existing methods for computing the value of entangled games are limited, and more efficient approaches are required.
objectives: Extend the result that the maximum winning probability of entangled XOR-games can be computed by a semidefinite program to uniform binary games.
Introduce a lower bound on the entangled value of a general two-player one-round game that can be computed by a semidefinite program.
methods: Apply semidefinite programming to compute the entangled value of uniform binary games and to establish a lower bound for general two-player one-round games.
Analyze the relationship between the entangled value and the optimum value of the corresponding semidefinite program for binary games.
results: The entangled value of uniform binary games can be efficiently computed using semidefinite programming.
A lower bound on the entangled value of general two-player one-round games is established, which can be computed by a semidefinite program.
The entangled value of binary games is bounded by the optimum value of the corresponding semidefinite program, with a guaranteed approximation ratio.
llama_json.research_subject: Computing the value of entangled binary games using semidefinite programming

motivations: The maximum winning probability of entangled XOR-games can be computed by a semidefinite program, but it's unclear if this extends to other types of binary games.
There is a need for an efficient method to compute the entangled value of uniform binary games.
A lower bound on the entangled value of a general two-player one-round game is not yet established.
objectives: Extend the semidefinite program method to compute the entangled value of uniform binary games.
Introduce a lower bound on the entangled value of a general two-player one-round game.
Demonstrate the relationship between the entangled value of a binary game and the optimum value of the corresponding semidefinite program.
methods: Use semidefinite programming to compute the entangled value of uniform binary games.
Develop a lower bound on the entangled value of a general two-player one-round game based on the size of the output set of each player.
Compare the entangled value of a binary game with the optimum value of the corresponding semidefinite program.
results: Provide an efficient method to compute the entangled value of uniform binary games.
Establish a lower bound on the entangled value of a general two-player one-round game.
Show that the entangled value of a binary game is within a specific range of the optimum value of the corresponding semidefinite program.
openai_json.research_subject: Computing the entangled value of binary games using semidefinite programming

motivations: Computing the maximum winning probability of entangled binary games is challenging for general cases beyond XOR-games.
There is a need for efficient methods to determine bounds on the entangled value of two-player one-round games.
objectives: Extend the computational framework for entangled game values from XOR-games to uniform binary games using semidefinite programming.
Establish a computable lower bound on the entangled value of general two-player one-round games.
methods: Develop semidefinite programming formulations to compute the entangled value of uniform binary games.
Derive mathematical bounds relating the entangled value to the semidefinite program optimum for binary games.
results: The entangled value of uniform binary games can be efficiently computed using semidefinite programming.
For binary games, the entangled value is bounded between 0.68 times and 1 times the semidefinite program optimum value.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Entangled value computation and bounds for two-player one-round binary games
